Project Gutenberg, founded in 1971, is the oldest producer and distributor of free ebooks.

According to Michael Hart (March 8, 1947 – September 6, 2011), founder of Project Gutenberg, the mission of Project Gutenberg is simple: to encourage the creation and distribution of eBooks.
This mission is, as much as possible, to encourage all those who are interested in making eBooks and helping to give them away.

I'm Zed Sehyr. I'm at San Diego State University. I do research on how languages (signed & spoken) are processed in the brain. I study the American Sign Language lexicon and how signers organize or represent signs in their mental lexicon.

I work with machine learning engineers, computer vision scientists & deaf people to develop linguistically informed tools for automatic sign recognition.

I'm hearing, and my languages are English, Czech & ASL.

Humanism, open source, some music, art, and nonsense.

Account is locked; a significant fraction of what I post is followers-only. Got a blank or nonsensical avatar, no visible activity, no pointers to your identity? I'll ignore your follow request. I might choose not to accept it for other reasons, too. 🙂

Sometimes I ask questions here. When I do, I would ask you to please reply with your own thoughts, not an LLM's response.
